website_summaries.verdict: The best budget hose extension kit to choose when you need a simple extender for waste management.
pros: The locking mechanisms of the hose use a swivel bayonet design to keep the connection tight and secure while in use
The locking rings are reusable in case of damage or general wear
cons: 10 foot length may be too limiting for some RV models

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered April 19. Today is May 26. The second time using this, went to dump my blackwater and the end where the hose is glued to the coupling that goes into the dump station came apart and left me with a mess. Not happy. Of course it is right outside my return window. POS will not buy again or recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: me I am

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Fittings / See UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: Worst quality fittings on a sewer hose we have ever owned. Failed in less than 20 days of use. Cannot return to Amazon because past 30 days since shipment. Stuck at an RV park with no legal way to drain. I researched the Internet in detail before I purchased. (Blogs, Forums, Facebook etc) and felt this was best for the buck. I was WRONG. Beware of fittings problem folks are having. UPDATE CAMCO and AMAZON came through. We are now happy customers. The customer service of both companies came through to keep a customer satisfied. Thank you for your integrity. And CAMCO has redesigned their fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure these are rugged and last longer than cheaper hoses. Unfortunately, the quality control seems lacking. The fitting on the end of one hose wasn't secured well. It failed under pressure and the fitting separated from the hose. After cleaning up that mess and examining the hose, it appears the fitting wasn't threaded on the spiral hose more than a turn or so. As I said, probably a good hose but check the ends to make sure they were installed correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Dan & Jen Nevada

customer_reviews.title: Make your life easier. No one wants to wrestle a dirty slinky.
customer_reviews.text: Get these hoses. Now. Seriously. These aren't the floppy, slinky style hoses that are a pain to wrangle and place properly. I mean, I really don't enjoy wrestling a potty slinky hose that much, maybe you do? These guys STAY where you put them. They're stiff, will lengthen or stay collapsed exactly as you set them, and if you put a turn in the hose, it stays! I recommend these over the cheaper slinky style any day. We all know that no site is perfect for placing the hoses - you've got bumps and dips and rocks to maneuver the hose around. These hoses just make it easier!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Cooper

customer_reviews.title: It’s 2019- RV sewer hoses should be perfected by now
customer_reviews.text: It’s 2019 and people have been using these sewer hoses for decades. They’re not complicated. A flexible hose and 2 ends with couplings that WONT leak is all the customers ask for. But alas, this thing has a small leak at the swivel coupling. There is no gasket to replace. There are no adjustments that can be made. Really after all these years of manufacturing, there are no excuses. 😞
customer_reviews.author: jahpeople

customer_reviews.title: Same quality as the stuff flowing through it
customer_reviews.text: If I could return it I would. Only used the extension piece maybe 1 or 2 times and when we needed it on our last trip because the sewer was too far away I found the end of the extension came off the coupler rendering it useless. Seems it was only held in place by some adhesive that completely melted off in the heat.
customer_reviews.author: dreamingat30fps

customer_reviews.title: It would be great, except--
customer_reviews.text: Had another Rhinoflex hose previously for 5-6 years. Liked it. Seal on trailer connection end started dripping. Looked for a seal but I never found one. Bought this one to solve that problem. Connectors for hose to fitting are different. The outside diameter is only 1/16" smaller than inside dimension of the square tube rear bumper where you store it. It's a tight fit to get it in and out. I made a wire brush to make sure it was clear of debris but still have to push and pull to force it. Might be OK on a new bumper, but if yours is dirty or dented at all, I'd pick a different hose.
customer_reviews.author: G. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 4" Bumper a bit Tricky..BUT
customer_reviews.text: Ok, at first we did not think it would fit our 4" bumper but it is a bit tricky. You have to rotate the hose fittings, as shown in the photos, to align with the corners of the bumper then the hose will slide right in. You will have to stow the included 90 degree elbow and extra caps/ couplers in a bin or somewhere else. Not a deal breaker but be aware. We keep ours in our "Set-Up/ Close Out" bin for easy access. Hose seems durable and of good quality for our use. Need a rugged hose checkout the Rhino Extreme. Same kit available but more durable hose.
customer_reviews.author: AGR

customer_reviews.title: Try it for fit quickly
customer_reviews.text: Had to wait to use it and discovered that one of the two hose ends (the female) is oversized and will not fit correctly to either the hose or the trailer sewer connection. I would guess that a bad factory mold is to blame. Other ends are fine but the oversize female end renders the extension totally useless 40 bucks / 2 makes 20 bucks thrown away.l Very good profit margin. Again, hook it up to itself as quickly as you can to check fit and return if it does not fit right.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Well made and good length
customer_reviews.text: Less than big box prices, well made and easy to expand or contract. I needed this intermediate length for our motor home. I didn't need 25 feet and was tired of using two pieces and dealing with their assembly, cleaning and storing. For me, one length makes a big difference. I like the way I can adjust or disconnect the hose from coupler for the tight opening our motor home has for the sewer hose. It is an easy and intuitive procedure. The hose seems quite durable and I don't feel like I'm going to break anything. Having the 90 degree sewer hookup designed this way makes it easier to connect and disconnect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Em K

customer_reviews.title: Great Hose!
customer_reviews.text: This hose works great! I have not had any issues with it. I also bought the Valterra Adjustable 50"-94" Hose Carrier  at the same time. These work great together. The entire hose, elbow, and adapter from this hose set fits inside the Valterra hose carrier. I am very happy with both of these items. The hose I received does not have any protruding wires some of the other reviewers complained about. I highly recommend the hose and the carrier. This is the first time I have had a hose which would completely fit inside a carrier with all of its components.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: The Cadillac of sewer drain hoses.  Did I actually write that?
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to assemble, doesn't leak, no clamps, holds up well for years and very sturdy. Forget those flimsy blue hoses that stretch and writhe like a drunk snake when you drain your tank this one stays right where you put it. I've been using one for 10 years on my fifth wheel camper and just bought this one for a new small caper I just bought. What I especially like is how it collapses with a snap and stays that way until you pull it out to length again. No more 15-20 feet of hose snaking all over going to the sewer connection just 5 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: Tellitlikeitis

customer_reviews.title: May not fit in your stock hose storage
customer_reviews.text: It works nicely. The size of some of the orange fittings make it difficult to fit into stock storage tunnel. We have to store it in a garbage bag in our tunnel storage with other items. Still, works well
customer_reviews.author: BRB

customer_reviews.title: Finish was not as expected with a plumbing product.
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed to see that the Camco RhinoFLEX was not inspected for a complete finish. I attached three pictures that show each end has the wire portion of the hose sticking out to catch anything possible (all four ends were this way..did not feel taking the fourth picture would help). Dealing with plumbing....if there is a way it will happen. I have not had a chance to use this product yet, but will make sure to cut off this extra material before I do. Did not expect flaws like this from a company that is suppose provide a quality product. Just make sure to check the hose. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Elicia Schultian

customer_reviews.title: It leaks! :(
customer_reviews.text: This product has Twist on ends that rotate. Unfortunately those ends also leak. If there is any black or grey water, you will be polluting the ground that it rests on. Not much but enough to create a regular stink. Instead buy a good quality hose and put your own ends on with a hose clamp. It's not that much more trouble and you'll avoid polluting the ground. Camco said the first one was just missing glue. So Amazon sent me a second 1 and it had the same issue. Camco said they would notify QC of the issue.
customer_reviews.author: old guy

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Although I didn't think we needed a new sewer hose, my husband had to have this one. He showed me all the features and it is the upgraded version of the one that came with the trailer. It was easy to use and my husband loved it. Not really sure why we needed it but it's a new toy for the trailer and we do use it every time we go camping so if it made him happy it was worth it. It does look sturdier than the original and it is cool that it folds up and can be longer than the one we had. I know that my husband would recommend it as he thinks it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Birdie

customer_reviews.title: What is pictured is not what I received
customer_reviews.text: The picture shows a removable coupler which is what I have on my other rhinoflex, but the one I received has a fixed and glued on coupler. The reason I ordered it was because of the removable coupler which allows me to have more flexibllity in the function of the sewer hose.
customer_reviews.author: Herm

customer_reviews.title: awful ... unless you want a sewer hose with holes!
customer_reviews.text: Went for our first camping trip of the year and thought we'd start the season with a new sewer hose. What a mistake. This brand new out of the box sewer hose had two very large holes and several small holes. Thankfully we were only emptying the gray tank vice black. And thankfully we had our old (going on 10 year old) sewer hose with us to accomplish our task. Am getting a product replacement, hopefully this will be better than our last.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Ann Hammack

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality. No Leaks. Fits in bumper
customer_reviews.text: Great quality hose. I experienced no leaks like the others have stated. The instructions clearly state to tighten everything before using and I am guess those experiencing leaks did not take the time. Also, it fits perfectly in my 4" square bumper. Again, those saying it doesn't problem can take the time to rotate it 10 degrees so the tabs line up with the corners of the bumper. I can fit both 10' sections with caps on each section in the bumper with room to spare. The elbow probably wouldn't fit in the bumper (I didn't try) but does come apart into two pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Hose does NOT come with the removable ends!
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered 4 different hose combinations from Camco, because I want the removable ends, as that is the only way a hose will fit in my storage tube. (2010 Pleasureway Excel TS). The product description clearly shows the removable ends in the product descriptions, but what arrives are FIXED end fittings, which I can NOT use!!! About to give up on Camco!
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Lusk, USN, ret

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit in bumper
customer_reviews.text: Does it's job. No idea on durability, have only used it 4 times now. Side note. If you are looking for a Hose after buying a brand new Forest River this will not fit in the bumper. Specially the forest River wolf pup 18to. I had to improvise with attaching a 5"x5" vinyl fence post.
customer_reviews.author: Britany

customer_reviews.title: Industry standard for high quality RV Sewer Hose
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used travel trailer and it had a very old hose in the rear bumper. I had seen these on RV's in parks and so I ordered it. It is very high quality and won't give you any surprises when you go to connect to an RV drain or dump station. The clear elbow is very helpful to let you know when the water coming out of the camper is clear. I recommend getting the folding support kit to go along with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to unscrew the threaded end from the campground sewer hole
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and, at both of the last two campgrounds, I could not get the orange end to unscrew from the campgrounds' sewer waste hole / opening. It's real embarrassing and stressful when the campground is pressuring you to get out, but you can't get the threaded orange plastic part out of the ground. I'm 6 foot three and reasonably strong, yet I struggle for 10 minutes to unscrew it. (?) Should I be putting some kind of DRY lubricant on the threads? If yes, what brand of dry lubricant should I purchase? I "don't" want to use a "wet" lubricant because that will add to the messiness of my storage compartment. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Steve is unemployed

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit securely on RV
customer_reviews.text: We camp mostly at places that do not have a sewer hookup at the campsite. We had been using our 15 ft hose and I thought it would be great when we leave the campground to get close to the sewer dump and use a 5 foot hose. This hose did not fit securely on our RV. Also it didn't fit tightly on the clear attachment that goes into the sewer. Very messy outcome. Very disappointed because it collapses to about 2 feet which is another reason we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Waste (excuse the pun) of Money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these hoses and within 2 weeks the black locking cap - that locks the actual hose onto the connector - came loose. There is no way to reattach it and it renders the hose useless. These hoses are NOT cheap and should last at least a full camping season if not longer. Instead of buying these just throw you money directly into the RV toilet!
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product was a waste, bought it May but finally got to use it in July. I wouldn’t have thought I would’ve needed to test it on something that is supposed to be a standard. The fittings were too big for the sewer outlet and would not seal so it would leak and would not latch to the secondary hose either. Had to hold it against the outlet during the dump but was able to get the second hose to clamp by switching them around but two ends were still not sealed / clamped. Also hose ends are pretty large in diameter so it won’t fit In the standard bumpers.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: The Stinky Slinky
customer_reviews.text: This sewer hose kit is everything you really need to empty your holding tanks. I like the caps you put on them when you stow them away, keeping the smell to a minimum. They easily compact and expand, and the elbow fitting is excellent for most dump stations. I like that there are two hoses in case you need the full 20' between your RV and the dump hole. I have yet to need to use more than one of the hoses to connect up to the sewer, but I am certain that one day I will need both hoses connected together for a sewer connection at a full hook-up site.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ellisberg

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Used a few times with our TT so far so good collapsible to fit in our plastic storage container. Have to remember to remove one of the two end caps to extend though they seal so well that the air can’t get in to expand. No leakage from any of the connections on either end when dumping or connected at the rv site. I am going to purchase an extension though due to it coming up short on the last trip due to location of the park connection, live and learn I guess. But so far very pleased with the quality and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff k

customer_reviews.title: Easy hook up
customer_reviews.text: Kit was complete and easy to install. Had ordered two 90 degree clear elbows to redirect the flow back under the RV to the other side. Works fine and all parts fit, even thought they are different brands. I am living in RV at permanent location and do not expect to move it for a while! I left durability with out stars as I have zero long term experience with this product.
customer_reviews.author: XXTEXX

customer_reviews.title: Too big for the bumper tube.
customer_reviews.text: Should have read the reviews better. Haven’t used it and just received it. Tried to put it in my rear bumper tube. It won’t go in. The collars are too big. Very disappointed. I see why there were so many in the warehouse. The cap for the dump station end does not lock on to of use either. Or lock on the adapter so I’m sure it will blow off when in use. Junk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best There Is
customer_reviews.text: Like most Camco products, this offers innovation and great value for the money. They have made the entire dumping process SO MUCH BETTER with this product. It still sucks and I know Camco will go next-gen because I know the process can be made better and I know they are the ones to do it. For now, this is hands-down the best there is.
customer_reviews.author: devynatorsmom

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Let’s face it, none of these hoses are going to smell great. This is my second sewer line and is far better both in durability and sealing than my last. This hose has a relatively thick wall and, with the caps on, seals very well. It is very flexible and collapses to about 4 feet. I have only used this 3 times but I am happy with it. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Pace

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my rv. Worked perfectly. Secures tightly to prevent leakage. It is also made of a sturdier plastic that you can bend however you want and it will stay in that position until you move it. This feature also allows you to shorten or lengthen the tube to fit your specidic situation at each campground. I didnt know that it did this until I got it (didn't read that far in the description) so it was a pleasant surprise. No leaks. The hard plastic also prevented it from accidentally flipping over when you take it off and letting waste spill out.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Hose with an elbow
customer_reviews.text: The hose comes in 2 sections that lock together to expand to about 20’. I’d guess the hose sections are each 3-4’ long when compressed. The connections on all ends are firmly attached and don’t leak after about 2 months of usage. It’s also got a clear elbow for attaching to the waste receptacle so you know when the fluid has stopped flowing.
customer_reviews.author: Frisco Kid

customer_reviews.title: The connectors fit into the bumper! Hooray!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, with good connections that don't leak. Ew! The thing I like the most is that I can keep the ends on and they store right inside my 4" bumper so it's a little less dirty work to set it up. Just pull it out, hald turn it onto the drain, screw in the sewer connector, one more turn and done! The rigid tube extends and collapses securely without flopping all over so you can get just the length you need without having to creatively snake it all over to create a long drain path like you might with other looser tubes. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: HikerChick

customer_reviews.title: Did not pass my test.
customer_reviews.text: It would be very difficult for me to give a low rating unless it was necessary. I bought this in April. The TT has been stationary. I just moved to a new site to finish out the season. I unhooked the hose and at the new site 200 yards away. I hooked it back up and almost every seem between the spring was slit and basically leaked. I would not buy this again or recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: The real review

customer_reviews.title: Needed Slight modification but quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I have used a few different dump hoses. This seems to be the best quality. The kinks are like a funny straw and they stay extended until you push it back small. Previous reviews have mentioned a poor quality connection to the ends. I pulled on mine and it didn't come apart. The metal piece mentioned in previous reviews appears to have also been corrected, as mine didn't have any issues like that. The problem I had was that the item was slightly too big for my 4" bumper and I had to use the belt sander to shave off about a thirty-second of an inch on the flats. Oh well, it fits and it's camping!
customer_reviews.author: kompewterz

customer_reviews.title: Note:  The elbow is permanently connected!
customer_reviews.text: What I was really wanting to get was an extension hose with the two endcaps. I saw this and thought that would fit the bill, but did not realize the elbow is permanently connected to the hose. So rather then being an extension hose, this is the primary hose for your tank dumping process. Other then that it is of the same quality as the other RinoFLEX hoses that I have been using. I really like the way the hoses compress down, and the end caps to keep them from dripping in the storage compartment.
customer_reviews.author: G. B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Takes a little getting used to, perfect for storing in a "stink" box
customer_reviews.text: The "sticky accordion" design takes a little getting used to. You have to pull on it to extend it and each section "pops" out. Because of this it stays in its compact position which makes storing it (in a box) a lot easier than traditional hoses. I compress my two sections then bend them into a U so that they fit nicely in a 3 foot wide storage box I have on the nose of my trailer.
customer_reviews.author: David J Grab

customer_reviews.title: Had holes all in the plastic
customer_reviews.text: First time we went to use this it had holes all in it. Contacted customer service and haven't heard anything back. Nothing like having waste sprayed everywhere. :( Update: Customer Service did contact me finally. However, no apology wanted proof that I wasn't lying. Asked for a photo, well apparently when my husband was sprayed with sewage, he trashed the hose. So buyer beware. We were out the money of the faulty hose, and left feeling like we were trying to be a criminal by asking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: JLT1997

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and made
customer_reviews.text: Can't go any better than these I think. Stood up to direct Arizona sunlight for six months with zero Fading. Good for another six months next year. The way these things collapse down is pretty unique and very much appreciated. So I can get all my fittings, all the hoses, everything onto one medium sized tote and into my TT pass through.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Good as extension hose or dump hose
customer_reviews.text: Video is out of date, product looks like picture (no locking collars). Seems nice as my first rhino flex and I assume ends stay on differently than with the locking black collar. This kit is nice because it's bayonet style both ends of both hoses, so you can use it as extension which is why I bought it. My other 15ft kit has the elbow for the dump directly on the hose end, this setup is better as it does not so you can just use it as extension with other hoses. Or you can use it as dump hose.
customer_reviews.author: Remical

customer_reviews.title: Nice accordion feature, tough tight fit may be deal breaker.
customer_reviews.text: Seems strong. Definite stiff accordion design. Makes adjustable length a little easier. Very difficult to get into my standard bumper storage tube. Thought about greasing the inside of the tube or sawing the end elbow 1/4” shorter to help it fit. Not sure I would rebuy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miles

customer_reviews.title: Hose came apart and sprayed me with feces like a fire hydrant. Not one but twice.
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this product. I Purchased two hoses two years ago. They were each used maybe 3-4 times. Both hoses were faulty and detached from the glued on coupling while dumping the black tank....not once, but twice with 2 different hoses. The coupling stayed attached to the RV while the hose fell off, spraying me with 60 gallons of human waste and toilet paper. I would suggest looking for a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: SPerkins

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, great length, durable
customer_reviews.text: Great waste hose. Left in place for a few months at a time through varied weather conditions, it hasn't apparently degraded nor leaked. Withstood standing waste and holding tank treatment in the line for maybe five days when the valve had been opened (probably by some mischievous kids in the campground) and the hose knocked off its supports so it couldn't flow to the dump hole. (I often leave on the weekends and didn't notice until midweek on my return, when it was time to dump again. ) Great length, good connections, but the adapter for the sewage connection doesn't fit some campground equipment well. I have a rubber friction adapter for those occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: be warned - it does not fit into the 4" square bumper
customer_reviews.text: Be warned - It does not fit into the 4" square bumper, if one uses it first time and after that tries to store in the RV bumper you'll have the surprise to see that it does not fit (if you brought the new one in the box from home). Hose itself would, but you'd need to remove the extremely hard to twist hose ends - who wants to do that with a used sewer hose...
customer_reviews.author: DNP

customer_reviews.title: Makes Tank Dumps FUN!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay... maybe not really fun... but it's certainly a lot easier to use this hose than it was to use the flimsy coiled hose that came with my RV. This hose is STURDY... expands and collapses easily for reaching those ore distant dump tanks and then sliding it back into its storage compartment. No problems at all since I started using this hose and I really can't recommend it highly enough. It's a superb product at a great price. Camco products really are nice to use.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Bosshard

customer_reviews.title: Impressive.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product that arrived on time and performs exactly as described. I am very pleased that I replaced my old sewer hose with this one. I do hope it has a long life. I am a part-time RV'er and finally grew very tired of wrestling with the hose and attachments that came with the use trailer I purchased. This product is so much better than the conventional 'slinky' style hose it is amazing. This is my first experience with the multi-size fittings, swivel connectors, and a firm hose that shrinks. I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: A three foot section in the middle of the hose collapsed (so that it was flat rather than round) in one of the early uses. Today, in the middle of draining my RV tanks, the hose decoupled from the head it was attached to. It is garbage now after maybe ten uses.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Maciver

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Anybody living the RV life full time as we are, knows full well about sewer hose problems. After trying vitually all the brands out there, I'm well pleased with the RhinoFlex kit. The ends are fully removeable so they can be trimmed if there's a tear. If the sani-dump opening is too small for the fittings, then you can put just the hose down the drain. These hoses are accordian style and are collapsible and tough. I haven't had any problem with them leaking either. They are the best I've ever seen and this kit includes all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A well constructed sewer hose kit
customer_reviews.text: We were working on my son's RV and I noted that his sewer hose had several holes in it. Since he was leaving in the morning I gave him my Camco RhinoFLEX RV Sewer Hose. It was around 5 years old and still in great working condition. Needing a replacement there was no hesitation to replacing it with another RhinoFlex hose. Pros It's tough yet yet flexible and easy to stow - it will help you get the job done. Cons None
customer_reviews.author: One old guy

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: Face it, it's a flexible plastic hose that gets dragged on the ground. Without extreme care, even the most robust hose will ultimately fail. It just takes one jagged rock or one careless foot. This Rhino (described as super durable) should be considered a good, solid baseline for evaluating similar products. With regular full-time use and a decent amount of care, this should last a whole year. But don't expect more than that. That way you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Biscuit

customer_reviews.title: A Good Kit for Longer Sewer Runs
customer_reviews.text: This is a good kit I use for longer runs. For shorter runs it tends to curl up. I like that the sewer connection is a separate piece that screws into a threaded sewer pipe and the hose then attaches to it. It won't install easily if the sewer entry is in a concave concrete pad but I carry a shorter sewer kit with a taller one piece curved sewer attachment and a rubber donut for this. A few times I have needed to connect both of my hoses together and neither has leaked. This hose can be crushed and can form a pin hole leak after some time, but it seems to hold up longer than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Decent but some pinholes between ribbing
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought several sets. I keep getting pin holes in the hoses and don’t know why. The connectors are getting discolored and faded. So far no cracks in the plastic though. I will update if anything new happens. Oh, i like these because when putting away, you can shrink them down to a very small length and they are not flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: It’s good, needs one thing fixed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this all over the country for over a year now, it does lock in very tightly and works great - as long as I only have to use the one 20’ section. When I add the other 20’ section, it doesn’t lock together at all so I have to tape it up and hope for the best. I always end up leaking sewage out around the connection and having to rinse it off. But if that connection was as tight as the others, this would be the best sewer hose on the market as far as I know.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: " WON'T FIT " -- Highly Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Rhino with high hopes. I have a 26' Travel Trailer and store the waste hose in the standard 4" OD back bumper (3 7/" ID). The hose itself looks to be made great BUT the end fittings will not fit in the storage bumper -- so, back to the drawing board. I have the product a "1" because it is not made to fit the standard storage location in the bumper and the description on Amazon does not indicate the Overall OD Size of the End fittings (Connector to the trailer / connector between the 2 ten foot lengths of hose)......
customer_reviews.author: Don M.

customer_reviews.title: Good fix for nasty work
customer_reviews.text: I hate sewer hoses and I particularly hate running a long one, even on those expandable hose elevators because no matter what you do, you still wind up lifting the hose to clear the drainage. So I thought, hey, I should get a really short one and pray that can get right up to the pipe. Easier said than done. I found this one but it has bayonet on both ends. Aha! I just attached a bayonet elbow to one end and voila! A short hose that doesn't need to be picked up during my least favorite RV chore, doesn't leak and attaches easily to the coach. Every RVer needs one of these!👍
customer_reviews.author: TruthTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: We have ordered a couple of these as it is less expensive to order a kit instead of just the hoses. We live full-time in our RV and it seems that about once a year we need to replace a section. Not due to the quality but because of wild animals usually. This time was a cow that got loose and stepped on the hose. It was not crushed but simply had a tear in the plastic material.
customer_reviews.author: Living Coast 2 Coast

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose as we hopped
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly with out 31rlss Winnebago Ultralite. Moved everything along out the drain and kept the smell contained as well as can be expected from a camper sewer line. We would always flush out black water tank and then our grey water to really make sure all the nasty stuff was out. Never noticed an issue with anything getting stuck in the variegated aspect of these lines either. Fit perfectly in the bumper storage as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Taylor

customer_reviews.title: lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hose last summer. I liked being able to see my grey water exiting out. I don't use my black tank, thank heavens. the hose lasted less than a year before the split happened. so the product is only good for year in the southern state elements. not sure about how I feel about having to replace a hose yearly? would I buy again? probably not, I want to see if another brand will hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: H. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Check all gaskets are there first
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and liked the weight and design...but it didn't fit tight around my sewer connector - I lost a lot of gray water and it was pretty gross holding the house to try and get a decent connection. After I got home I read a bunch of reviews and discovered they didn't include all the gaskets!!! I contacted Camco and they sent me 2 very quickly which is why I still gave them 4 stars. It now fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Freedom Wrighter

customer_reviews.title: Not all poo hoses are created equal, and these are superior
customer_reviews.text: Yea boi, I really like these a lot. These do not "bunch" up too tight and while easy to maneuver, you can tell they are well made. Trust me, if you have ever deal with inexpensive crappy (see what I did there) hoses you will find these far superior in just about every aspect. Even Camco makes some really useless hoses, but they hit the mark with this system. The elbow has fit everywhere I have taken it, and the lugs fit and lock very well. Considering most KOA's are packed in like sardines, the last thing I want to do is have a livermush poo explosion next to my neighbor's picnic table. That just make Bingo night weird.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan117

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the reviews but have used this for the summer and fall seasons and found nothing wrong with the product. It works as described. Once winter hit, the parks we went to had hoses hooked up already because of freezing weather and snow. I assume those are better quality hose, but I couldn't tell the difference in function. I highly recommend the backwash adapter as well. I was able to clean out both tanks and be confident they were ready for winter.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Schubert

customer_reviews.title: Beware of turd spray!
customer_reviews.text: Ok,s o i just got a new one of these for a different RV, the one i have hasnt had any issues, but this one had a significant defect that resulted in serious F'ing TURD juices all over. The sewer hose part that connects to the rv was not fully in the connector which was not obvious at the time of hook up but when i opened the valve and let her rip, the f'ing turd hose fell off and turd juices went everywhere. Needless to say i will be returning this item, why in the world they would want me to return it, i don't know but hopefully whoever opens it has gloves on...ughhh!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Connector broke after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought in December 2018 and have used multiple times till August 2019. The connector broke off and can no longer use hose. Thank goodness we had the extra length with us. This has always been stored securely not sure what happened.
customer_reviews.author: AEF

customer_reviews.title: Got to have this hose when you own an RV
customer_reviews.text: When we bought our RV I read a lot of reviews on must haves and amazon became my best friend. This hose seemed to be at the top of the RV list for get it ......you won’t regret it. Well the reviews were correct. Black tank duties fall to my husband and he says great buy to me every time he uses it. The clear plastic helps greatly in knowing when you can stop black and start grey water and then when you have it clean when clear water comes down. So glad we bought this for a dirty little job but a must when you own an RV.
customer_reviews.author: shopinful

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like this hose. Cheaper quality plastic than other rubberized hoses. Also, the ribs seem larger so they collect more garbage. The connectors have little grip so I find them hard to attach and detach. Lastly, the connector is made of two pieces that come apart easily. Not a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine C. Pardini

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit into bumper as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The description states it will fi into the rear bumper of the RV. I have a forest River product. 2018 Model year. The hose slid into the bumper but then would not pull out without damaging the hose. Now I have a section with bent wires. The other section would not slid into the bumper. Very disappointed. Waisted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Gary P.

customer_reviews.title: Junk product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second hose I purchased. They are junk, less than 10 months old split open when i pulled the black water valve. Needless to say it was a mess. I am done with the cheep RV sewer hoses. My next one will be a Lippert Waste Master RV Sewer Hose w/ Leakproof Camlock and 90-Degree Nozzle - 20' Long. I use the RV full time and tired of messing with the sewer hose that leak.
customer_reviews.author: Zumoking

customer_reviews.title: New collar design a bit too large for the bumper tube.
customer_reviews.text: What I like first: I have used RhinoFLEX hoses with my rv for years and the solid fit of the screw-on ends is outstanding, if you screw the fitting on tight and lock the collar. Durability of the hose is also unmatched. Now what I don’t like: The design of the new collar makes it difficult to slide into a standard rv bumper tube. Since it has been redesigned it’s too big with the cap in place, which was a major feature of the hose.
customer_reviews.author: DaveToerper

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I used it for the first time today with my Camco Waste Tank (another review) and the orange end just snapped off. I'm a 68 year old woman and I did not over-tighten the end. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Too fancy for me - harder to use than a normal waste hose.
customer_reviews.text: This is only my second waste hose. My old one was plain jane - this one is supposed to be cooler because it pops out to expand and pops back into a shorter version when you are done. What I don't like is that when the waste is in the hose it pops into the longer form and is kind of a hassle. I think the problem is the "RhinoFLEX" feature. Also the fittings at the end come unscrewed when you are trying to screw the hose onto your RV fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Ethosian

customer_reviews.title: Past CAMCO products have been great. Was very hesitant to purchase due to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Tough call here. Past CAMCO products have been great. Was very hesitant to purchase due to the catastrophic failure comments in the reviews. I'm one for one here. One of the hoses has worked perfectly. The other has a leak on one end. One was purchased at Amazon, the other at Walmart. Unfortunately, I don't know which one is which. I will reorder another from Amazon and pray it's the good one. There's few things one fears more than a sewer hose failure when dealing with a travel trailer. While I should have deducted one more star, I'll let it stand since one hose worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: VAF84

customer_reviews.title: It's a quality product but is a very tight fit in my RV's 4" square bumper
customer_reviews.text: But it does fit, just barely. I can store two 10' sections in my RV's bumper. I'm hesitant to store anything to do with draining the black water tank in my storage compartments so this was a must fit. I like the end cap accessory because I've had wasps build nests inside the tubing before, even though the bumper has swivel end plates there is enough of a gap for wasps.
customer_reviews.author: Highland Horseman

customer_reviews.title: Collapses nicely.  Fits perfectly in the bumper.
customer_reviews.text: I bought another companies hose when we purchased our travel trailer. It may be more of a heavy duty hose material, but I like the collapsible ease of this hose. This one I got in a 10' length and it has been all I've needed except for one site during the past 8 months of weekend camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Lee B.

customer_reviews.title: Good design, well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good design, and it's well made. The hose design is particularly good as you can push it together to keep it only as long as you need it, eliminating unnecessary bends and allowing for the most efficient flow. Well made connectors on each end.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hose. No issues yet
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad that we bought this. We also bought the sidewinder by CAMCO as well. We leave our camper on a se also all site all summer.. the camping sits have FULL hookups... we when we set up we don’t have to move the camper until the season is over. We replaced our old black water and gray water hoses... and bought this set up. I would recommend purchasing the SIDEWINDER HOSE HOLDER AS WELL to use with this.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great hose but elbow is not removable.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best sewer hose I have used. I like that you can stretch it out and it stays that length, rather than wanting to pull itself back to its compressed length. My only complaint is that the clear elbow is not removable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Holes!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 hoses and they are very weak in the creases where it flexes. Out of the box upon first use there were multiple holes in one hose. The other hoes worked OK until I dropped my keys on it, and the keys punctured it just by dropping less than 3 feet. Will absolutely not use this brand ever again unless I plan on buying new hoses every time I use them. Way too expensive for that.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with cap for the elbow
customer_reviews.text: Warning!!!!! Does not come with the cap for the elbow. You will need to order Camco Rhino Flex Cap Bayonet And Elbow Cap - Seals Both Ends of Your Sewer Hose to Form a Odor Tight Connection While Storing (2 Pack) (39753) The hose is great would get five stars if they included the cap for the elbow. Come on Camco put it in your 20 ft kit.
customer_reviews.author: rcboals

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Every RVer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for a less than thrilling activity. It does require a final assembly (tightening the hose end adapters) but that is better than having a hose that leaks. This hose easily and securely attaches to the RV and matching fittings. It DOES NOT LEAK! It cleans up easily (as long as it is completely extended), and stores easily in the 4"x4" bumper.
customer_reviews.author: apropdoc

customer_reviews.title: It won’t easily retract: Disappointingly inferior to the last RhinoFlex I owned
customer_reviews.text: This is my second RhinoFlex hose. The first one lasted for years and performed well. I was able to extend it to the length desired, and then I was able to retract it to its original short length by just pushing it back together for storage. It stayed retracted until the next use. Although this new hose looks the same, this one is different. After use, I cannot get it to retract in size no matter what I do. This makes storage very difficult and annoying. There may be a way to do it, but if there is, I haven’t figured it out yet. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: David GarthTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This sewage hose is durable and functional. Those are the two only things I care about in a sewage tube. I made the mistake of buying a cheaper hose before. It was a crappy situation. Thanks for making an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Schmoop McDoople

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year in July - we've been camping a handful of times. This past weekend I went camping on a girls trip and when I was at the dump station emptying the tank, the hose comes away from the attachment. Thank goodness I was wearing a large pair of rubber gloves - waste went everywhere. I had to hold the hose to the attachment to finish emptying the tank. I'm so disappointed in this product and almost threw up when the hose just popped off the attachment.
customer_reviews.author: AVest

customer_reviews.title: Good design.
customer_reviews.text: I've seen others mention problems with the end becoming disconnected from the hose at awkward times but I've not had that problem. I think the cause my be not having the hose connector tightened securely. There is a ratcheting feature that engages when the two are brought together but you must make extra effort to screw then together tightly before using. I also like the hose end caps that are included.
customer_reviews.author: judb

customer_reviews.title: It's okay...
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this hose for over a year now. The material has held up. I like the end caps as it keeps things cleaner. The bulk of the ends are a little annoying, making it harder to store in a bumper (ya have to fiddle with it to get it to fit just so). If you have more narrow bumper storage, forget it. Another annoying feature is the little nubs for connecting to the threaded adapter can easily pop out.
customer_reviews.author: J. DoyleTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used many but I'll use this one again!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sewer hose for my RV. The attachment features are very robust and easy to use. The clear 90 elbow lets you see when your tanks are empty and the collapsible design are great for storage and really stretching out when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Flippin 416

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Very Unhappy With Durability
customer_reviews.text: I'm very dissatisfied with the fact that I hadn't used one end of the hoses I ordered until 2 days ago. I connected the 2 hoses together from the seller and realized the connection between the 2 leaked very badly. I disconnected and reconnected several times to no avail. I looked inside to if the gasket seal was moved or broken. It was not. I've now had these 60 days and there is no reason for this to be leaking. Very upset.
customer_reviews.author: Julia D

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a backup hose for the 42 gallon waste tank. Quality looks good and had this brand before with no issues. You will need an adapter piece to use this on a portable waste tank though.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Leaked.  Did not come with washer and cased it to leak.
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work as advertised. Hooked up to camper and dumped but leaked and since found out it did not have rubber washer. Not happy having sewer come out under camper. Not happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Jackson

customer_reviews.title: I really like that they come with caps for the ends!!
customer_reviews.text: We really like these hoses. They collapse somewhat on themselves and they take up a lot less room in the plastic tub that we store them in. I like the fact that they come with caps for the ends. Also the clear adapter lets you see when the black tank is clean out. No more guessing that it is clean you know now cause you can see whats coming out of the end of the sewer hose. SO MUCH BETTER!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended - 1 of 2 hoses came with a leak
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these hoses for my new RV. I stored them in my home until our first camping trip and then put them in my RV storage bin (basement) inside a utility tub. The first time I used them, one had a pinhole leak. So much fun draining my waste tank and having the water come spraying out of the hose. And apparently I'm outside my return window, since I didn't go camping soon enough after purchase. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Priebe

customer_reviews.title: Great RV Hose
customer_reviews.text: Camco Rhino is a great hose. Ive not had one break or crack on me despite bending it many time over and over from putting them into position when camping. When you put the hose away it comes with caps for the ends so there is no smell.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Easily positions and stays in place!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this hose compared to simple stretch slinky hose. Stretch it out and it stays, makes it easy direction the hose perfectly to outlet. Stays in place. Really like the clear elbow as I can tell if the system is cleaned out. Believe me this is a must have for campers. We were new to camping last year and didn’t realize how much easier it was to hook up and clean out with this new hose. Don’t hesitate to purchase the hose, you will love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Not the product pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Not the pictured item, it is a Rhino, but not a FLEX. Also not sure of the durability, dont want to test it. Angle connection is not translucent but clear ( there is a difference) also no extra reinforced black connection on each end where piping meets the orange connection. If it wasnt so reasonably priced i would return it but dont feel like the hassle plus i need a poopy tube this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Well... it broke.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because of good reviews. When I first saw it I was worried the plastic tube part would crack, but instead one of the end pieces was cheaply glued in and came apart... sewage everywhere. Tried using duct tape, gorilla tape, and industrial glue to hold it together but the piece doesn't even fit in right and now everything is gross. It worked fine for a month and a half but now it's past the one month for refunds. I did not reach out to the seller or Amazon because I assume this is just part of the dumping life. Hopefully others have better luck, as it would seem so from the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not slide into my 4 inch square tube trailer bumper...
customer_reviews.text: The product seems well made, but will not slide very far into my bumper without sticking. I don't want to force it and have it stuck. So, it looks like that didn't work out very well. They should have make the fittings just a tad smaller as there is nothing in the tube that I can see stopping it. Because of that I gave it 3 stars. They missed it big time!!!
customer_reviews.author: H. M. Johnson III

customer_reviews.title: Missing Gasket
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use on our very first camping trip and found that when we were dumping our black tank the rubber gasket was missing and made a huge mess on the ground and on my husband. My husband was irate by this time, we had to go all over town to try and find a gasket that would fit so the tanks would not leak when we emptied them. So beware if you order this that your hose has a gasket attached. I am very disappointed in this product and would not recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: John Barbour

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: This leaked where the hose attaches to the fitting end that attached to the RV. Pull the drain valves and it's drip, drip, drip. That's unsanitary and unacceptable. Sending back stinky hoses doesn't seem like a good option so I tried sealing the joints with silicone. We'll see if that works.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Stop searching and buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: We just bought our first travel trailer and needed a replacement hose.The dealership we bought the trailer from gave us a starter package with some chemicals, a small garden hose, and a sewer hose. ...Nice other than everything we got was garbage. So after the first trip and disappointment with the hose coming unattached from the dump sight. :( I went online and found this hose. The caps to cut off the horrid smell is why I purchased it, but the strength, quality of all the plastic parts, and control of using it is why I love it.
customer_reviews.author: James J.

product_meta.title: Camco RhinoFLEX Heavy Duty 10ft RV Sewer Hose Extension Kit with Swivel Fitting - Extends Your Sewer Hose to Fit Your Needs (39764)
product_meta.description: Style:10ft Sewer Hose Extension Kit| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingExtend the reach of your Rhino FLEX or other sewer hose with this handy kit. Includes 10-foot Rhino FLEX hose with pre-attached swivel lug and bayonet fitting. Patent pending. Works with any sewer hose that has a bayonet fitting.
feature_bullets: Kit Includes: 10-foot Rhino FLEX extension with (1) pre-attached lug and bayonet fitting
Compatibility: Compatible with any sewer hose that has a bayonet fitting
Fittings Swivel: For ease of use and designed to stay sealed
Easy to Store: Hose compresses to 39-inches including fittings for easier storage and will fit in 4-inch square bumpers
Durable Construction: Rhino FLEX sewer hose is made of 23 mils of durable polyolefin and reinforced with steel wire; Includes permanent, no leak fittings

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars8,768 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
